key.name: event-update-rate-ms
key.summary: How often XR related events should be processed
key.description: This affects events like polling the XR runtime for updated tracked device poses, determining if a controller points at an overlay, and performing window management. This value is also the basis for the overlay push/pull and scale functions to be fps independent.

key.name: scroll-threshold
key.summary: How big of a touchpad movement should generate a scroll event
key.description: The touchpad values range from -1.0 to 1.0 in both directions. Moving the finger about this value on the touchpad causes a scroll event to be emitted akin to a mousewheel being turned one position.

key.name: scroll-to-push-ratio
key.summary: How much the push/pull gesture should be amplified
key.description: While dragging a window, the touchpad's or thumbstick's y axis can push/pull a window away or nearer. This value determines how fast this happens.

key.name: scroll-to-scale-ratio
key.summary: How much the scale gesture should be amplified
key.description: While dragging a window, the touchpad's or thumbstick's x axis can scale a window's size. This value determines how fast this happens.

key.name: analog-threshold
key.summary: Analog input below this threshold is ignored
key.description: A thumbstick might not rest at perfectly (0,0). This setting specifies a deadzone in which values are ignored.

key.name: overlay-minimum-size-meter
key.summary: The minimum size of a window
key.description: Windows are prevented from being scaled smaller than this value.

key.name: overlay-maximum-size-meter
key.summary: The maximum size of a window
key.description: Windows are prevented from being scaled bigger than this value.

key.name: pointer-tip-resolution
key.summary: The pixel resolution of the pointer tip.
key.description: This option has no effect on the visible size of the pointer tip. Higher resolutions only result in improved quality. Note: Texture resolution will be largert than this value for being able to render animations without having to allocate larger textures.

key.name: pointer-tip-apparent-width-is-constant
key.summary: Whether the pointer tip should have the same apparent size, independent from the distance to the user.
key.description: This option disables the expected perspective of the pointer tip getting smaller when it is farther away.

key.name: pointer-tip-width
key.summary: Either the width or the apparent width of the pointer tip, depending on the pointer-tip-apparent-width-is-constant option.
key.description: When pointer-tip-apparent-width-is-constant is disabled, this option sets the width of the pointer tip. When pointer-tip-apparent-width-is-constant is enabled, this option sets the apparent width such that it always appears to have this width as if seen in 3 meter distance. The value of 3 meter was chosen because at typical usage distances, it makes the pointer tip usable both with pointer-tip-apparent-width-is-constant enabled and disabled.

key.name: cursor-width
key.summary: The width of the cursor that is copied from the desktop, respects pointer-tip-apparent-width-is-constant.
key.description: When pointer-tip-apparent-width-is-constant is disabled, this option sets the width of the cursor. When pointer-tip-apparent-width-is-constant is enabled, this option sets the apparent width such that it always appears to have this width as if seen in 3 meter distance.

key.name: active-pointer-tip-color
key.summary: The color of an active pointer tip e.g. pointing at an overlay

key.name: pointer-tip-animation-alpha
key.summary: The opaqueness of the pointer tip animation

key.name: inactive-pointer-tip-color
key.summary: The color of an inactive pointer tip i.e. not point at anything
